member.name: T:JPFITS.AstraCarta
member.summary: Provides query access to the Gaia Archive, for downloading catalogue regions given an RA, DEC, and field scale and size, etc. Used by WCSAutoSolver.

member.name: M:JPFITS.AstraCarta.Query(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary: Perform a query with no user interface dialog form. Will throw an informative exception if something goes wrong. Returns a string which is the filename of the catalogue data downloaded. If nothing was found the string will be empty.
member.param: The right acension of the field center.
The declination of the field center.
The plate scale in arcseconds per pixel.
The number of horizontal pixels of the image.
The number of vertical pixels of the image

Optional arguments list. Possible arguments can be found here: https://github.com/user29A/AstraCarta/wiki, or with AstraCarta.Help call.
Be sure to pass the switch "-argument"; for example do not pass "buffer", but pass "-buffer", etc.
Arguments and their values must be consecutive, for example: optArgs.Add("-buffer); optArgs.Add(2); and so on.
Boolean arguments do not require a value, and their presence indicates true. For example the presence of optArgs.Add("-fitsout") equates to true for writing the file as a FITS bintable.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.GetTTYPEEntry(System.String,System.TypeCode@,System.Int32[]@,JPFITS.FITSBinTable.TTYPEReturn)
member.summary: Return a binary table entry as an Array object. Its type and rank are given to the user. Includes options for specifying the precision of the return.
member.param: The name of the binary table extension entry, i.e. the TTYPE value.
The TypeCode of the underlying data in the TTYPE. NOTE: strings are TypeCode.Char.

A vector to return the properties of the return Array:
If the return is a numeric vector or vector of strings of all the same length, it contains only one element, being the length of the vector (NAXIS2).
If the return is a numeric 2D array, it contains the width of the array as the first element, and the height of the array (NASIXS2) as the second element.
If the return is from the heap, therefore as a vector of vectors (numeric or string), therefore containing a variable number of elements on each row, then it is a vector containing the number of elements of the vector on each row.
If the ttypeEntry has TDIM keywords for an n >= 3 dimensional array, then it contains the TDIM values for each TDIMn keyword. It therefore should have at least 3 elements.
Use this option to force a non-native return for the Array precision. For example, a user may want single or int values returned as all doubles, or all values returned as strings.

member.summary: Use this to access individual elements of the table with a string return of the value. Useful for looking at TTYPEs with multiple elements on a row, or, for extracting values for display purposes, etc.
member.param: The index of the TTYPE value.
The row index of the column.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.GetTTypeEntryRow(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Use this to access individual elements of the table with a string return of the value. Useful for looking at TTYPEs with multiple elements on a row, or, for extracting values for display purposes, etc.
member.param: The name of the binary table extension entry, i.e. the TTYPE value.
The row index of the column.

member.summary: Remove one of the entries from the binary table. Inefficient if the table has a very large number of entries with very large number of elements. Operates on heap-stored data where required.
member.param: The name of the binary table extension entry, i.e. the TTYPE value.

member.name: T:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.EntryArrayFormat
member.summary: Provides options for specifying the nature of the data added to a BINTABLE.

member.name: F:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.EntryArrayFormat.Default
member.summary: The entryArray is a 1-dimensional array of numeric or string values, or is a 2-dimensional array of numeric values only. If entryArray is a 1-D array of strings, all strings must be the same length, otherwise specify IsHeapVariableRepeatRows.

member.name: F:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.EntryArrayFormat.IsComplex
member.summary: The entryArray is a 2-dimensional array of complex (real, imaginary) numeric value pairings, of either single or double floating point precision. The width of the array can be greater than two, but must be an even number given the pairings.

member.name: F:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.EntryArrayFormat.IsHeapVariableLengthRows
member.summary: The entryArray is a vector containing variable-length vectors of numeric values, or it is an array of variable-length strings, either of which must therefore be stored in the heap area.

member.name: F:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.EntryArrayFormat.IsHeapComplexVariableLengthRows
member.summary: The entryArray is a vector containing variable-length vectors of complex value pairings, of either single or double floating point precision, which therefore must be stored in the heap area. The length of each vector of the rows must be an even number given the pairings.

member.name: F:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.EntryArrayFormat.IsNDimensional
member.summary:
The entryArray is a numeric vector but which is to be interpreted as an n-dimensional array of rank r >= 3, for which the TDIM values will be provided giving the number of elements along each dimension of the array, which will be written into the header as the TDIMn keys.
The optional argument for tdims *MUST* be provided with this option.
NOTE that the array must be supplied as a vector or 2D array but which is to be understood as a rank r >= 3 array via the TDIM keywords. Do not actually pass a rank r >= 3 array.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.AddTTYPEEntry(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Array,JPFITS.FITSBinTable.EntryArrayFormat,System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Add a vector, 2D array, or a vector of variable-length vectors, of numeric, complex numeric, string values, or rank >= 3, to the binary table as a TTYPE entry.
The entryArray must be the same neight NAXIS2 as the previous entry additions if any exist.
If entryArray is a variable repeat heap-area array then the entry must be supplied as an vector of vectors, or an vector of strings; if complex each subarray must contain an even pairing of values.
If adding a complex number array to the binary table, the entryArray must be either single or double floating point, and must be a factor of two columns repeats where the 1st and odd numbered columns are the spatial part, and the 2nd and even numbered columns are the temporal part.
If entryArray is to be interpreted as rank >= 3, then array dimensions need to be supplied with the optional tdim argument after the EntryArrayFormat.IsNDimensional option. If entries already exist then the user must have formatted the entryArray to match the existing table height NAXIS2.
member.param: The name of the binary table extension entry, i.e. the TTYPE value.
Replace the TTYPE entry if it already exists. If it already exists and the option is given to not replace, then an exception will be thrown.
The TUNITS physical units of the values of the array. Pass empty string if not required.
The array to enter into the table.
Specify entryArray format for non-default (trivial) cases.
Specify the array dimensions for rank r >= 3, to be written as the TDIM keywords.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSBinTable.SetTTYPEEntries(System.String[],System.String[],System.Array[])
member.summary:
Set the bintable full of basic entries all at once. More efficient than adding a large number of entries once at a time. Useful to use with a brand new and empty FITSBinTable. NOTE: THIS CLEARS ANY EXISTING ENTRIES INCLUDING THE HEAP.
Do not use for n >= 3 dimensional, or complex, or heap (variable-repeat) entries.
member.param: The names of the binary table extension entries, i.e. the TTYPE values.
The physical units of the values of the arrays. Pass null if not needed, or with null elements or empty elements where not required.
An array of vectors or 2D arrays to enter into the table as TTYPEs, all of which have the same height NAXIS2.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSFILEOPS.ScanPrimaryUnit(System.IO.FileStream,System.Boolean,System.Collections.ArrayList@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Scans the primary unit of a FITS file. Returns false if the file is not a FITS file.
member.param: The FileStream of the FITS file, positioned at the start of the stream.
True to set the FileStream fs position to the end of the data block, otherwise the fs position will be at the end of the primary header block, i.e. at the beginning of the primary data.
Returns the header of the unit as an ArrayList with each 80-character header line being a String member of this list. Pass null if not required.
Returns whether or not the FITS file may contain extensions.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSFILEOPS.ScanImageHeaderUnit(System.IO.FileStream,System.Boolean,System.Collections.ArrayList@,System.Boolean@,System.Int32@,System.Int32[]@,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Scans an IMAGE unit of a FITS file. Returns false if the file is not a FITS file. Returns essential IMAGE keyword values. Can be used to scan the primary image unit or IMAGE extensions.
member.param: The FileStream of the FITS file, positioned at the start of the stream, or, at the start of any IMAGE extension unit.
True to set the FileStream fs position to the end of the data block, otherwise the fs position will be at the end of the header block, i.e. at the beginning of the data unit.
Returns the header of the unit as an ArrayList with each 80-character header line being a String member of this list. Pass null if not required.
Returns whether or not the FITS file may contain extensions. Returns true if the unit being scanned is itself an extension.
BITPIX keyword value. Bits per pixel keyword, following the meaning of the FITS convection.
An array of length NAXIS containing the dimension (length) of each axis. If there are no axes, is an emtpty array. NAXIS1 = naxisn[0]; NAXIS2 = naxisn[1]; etc.
The BSCALE keyword value. Default return is one (1) if not present.
The BZERO keyword value. Default return is zero (0) if not present.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSFILEOPS.ReadImageDataUnit(System.IO.FileStream,System.Int32[],System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32[]@,System.Double,System.Double,JPFITS.FITSFILEOPS.ImageDataUnitFormatting)
member.summary: Reads the image data unit from a FITS file and returns its Array at double-precision. Supports image data units with up to 3 axes. May return either a vector, table, or cube.
member.param: The FileStream of the FITS file, positioned at the start of the primary or image extension data unit.

Pass null or range[0] = -1 to default to full data unit size. Otherwise range is ZERO BASED 1-D int array [xmin xmax] or [xmin xmax ymin ymax] or [xmin xmax ymin ymax zmin zmax] to return a sub-array.
Populate the Array object with parallelization after serial disk read.
The BITPIX keyword value of the data unit header.

An array containing the values of the NAXISn keywords from the data unit header. Specifies the rank of the return Array, i.e., if naxisn.Length == 1, then it is a vector, if 2 then a table, if 3 then a cube. The value may change from the input given the ImageDataUnitFormatting options.
The BSCALE keyword value of the data unit header.
The BZERO keyword value of the data unit header.
Options for formatting the return Array rank and dimensions.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSFILEOPS.GetByteFormattedImageDataUnit(System.TypeCode,System.Boolean,System.Array)
member.summary: Returns a data unit as a byte array formatted at a specified precision. Useful for writing.
member.param: The precision at which to format the byte array of the underlying double precision data unit. If double values of the data unit exceed the precision, the values are clipped.
Populate the byte array with parallelism over the data unit. Can speed things up when the data unit is very large.
The data unit of up to rank three (data cube). Higher dimensional data than rank = 3 not supported.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSFILEOPS.SeekExtension(System.IO.FileStream,System.String,System.String,System.Collections.ArrayList@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Find the FITS extension table of the given type and name. Returns false if the XTENSION type of the specified EXTNAME is not found. If extension_name is found the FileStream fs will be placed at the beginning of the extension's main data table block.
member.param:
The FileStream of the FITS file, positioned at the start of the stream.
If EXTNAME is found the FileStream fs will be placed at the beginning of the extension's main data table block.
If EXTNAME is NOT found it will be at the end of the file.
The XTENSION extension type, either: "BINTABLE", "TABLE", or "IMAGE".
The EXTNAME extension name. If the extension is known to have no EXTNAME keyword and name, then pass an empty String and the first nameless extension of the specified type will be seeked.
Returns the header of the extension as an ArrayList with each 80-character header line being a String member of this list. Pass nullptr if not required.
Returns the start position within the FileStream of the extension...i.e. at the block boundary at the start of its header.
Returns the end position within the FileStream of the extension, including after any heap, rounded up to a multiple of 2880 bytes at the last block boundary.
Returns the end position within the FileStream of the main data table, NOT rounded to a data block boundary.

Returns the number of bytes of any remaining fill plus supplemental heap data area after the main table endposition, IF any heap data exists. Does not represent fill bytes after the main table if no heap exists. Does not include fill bytes after the heap.
Returns the position within the filestream of the beginning of the heap relative to the beginning of the main table. Nominally equal to NAXIS1 * NAXIS2 unless THEAP keyword specifies a larger value.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSHeaderKey.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary:
Creates an instance of a FITSHeaderKey, out of a supplied String line. The line may be empty, but not more than 80 elements length. The key will be formatted as a FITS comment line if its internal structure appears to be configured as such.
Comment lines are indicated either with COMMENT as the first characters, and, or, no equal sign at element position 9, 0-based index 8.
member.param: The header key line, up to 80 elements in length.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSHeaderKey.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance of a FITSHeaderKey, out of a supplied key name, key value, and key comment. If name is either "COMMENT" or an empty String the key will be formatted as a FITS comment line using comment.
member.param: The header key name, maximum 8 characters in length, all caps; excess elements will be truncated. Use COMMENT or pass empty string for a comment-formatted line with the value empty and comment as the comment line.
The header key value, maximum 18 characters in length; excess elements will be truncated. Leave empty if it is a comment line.
The header key comment, maximum 80 characters if it is the entire comment line, or maximum 73 characters if name is COMMENT; excess elements will be truncated.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSImage.WriteImage(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.TypeCode,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Write a FITS image to disk as an extension to a given file name.
member.param:
File name. Pass the object's own FullFileName to write to its existing file name.
If the file doesn't yet exist on disk, then a new file will be created with an empty Primary Unit, and the image will be written as an extension.
If the file does exist, then the extension will be written with the logic for the overwriteIfExists parameter, and
the existing primary unit and any other extensions will be conserved to the file.

The EXTNAME extension name of the IMAGE extension. Please do not use nameless extensions.
If an empty string is passed, the first nameless IMAGE extension will be written to.
If no such extension exists, the extension will be written as a new extension to the FITS file.
If the image extension already exists it can be overwritten. If it exists and the option is given to not overwrite it, then an exception will be thrown.
Byte precision at which to write the image data.
Populate the underlying byte arrays for writing with parallelization.

member.summary: FITSImageHeader class for managing FITS file Primary Image headers.

member.name: M:JPFITS.FITSHeader.#ctor(System.Boolean,System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary:
Constructor. Creates an instance of a FITSHeader, with options to indicate whether extensions are present, and sets essential keywords for a given image it will be the header for.
If the image is to be an extension, then use GetFormattedHeaderBlock to pull the header out with SIMPLE = T changed to XTENSION = IMAGE for writing.
member.param: If true, heyword EXTEND = T is added, otherwise it is left out.

If image is null, then NAXIS = 0 and there are no NAXISn keywords or BSCALE or BZERO. Otherwise NAXIS, NAXISn, BSCALE and BZERO are set as per the image dimensions.
If the image will be saved at a different precision than double, use SetBITPIXNAXISBSCZ(precision, image) at write time.

member.summary:
Scans all primary FITS headers in the FITSImageSet for identical lines and copies such lines to the specified FITSImage destination primary header.
Usage is that perhaps you form the mean of the FITSImageSet as a new FITSImage, and this new FITSImage should contain all the primary header
lines which are identical in the FITSImageSet.
The existing primary header of the FITS_destination is cleared before the operation, except for essential keywords.

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.Fit_Gaussian1d(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[]@,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Determines the non-linear least-squares fit parameters for a positively-oriented Gaussian curve G(x|p)
G(x|p) = p(0) * exp( -(x - p(1))^2 / (2*p(2)^2) ) + p(3)
member.param: The x-data grid positions of the Gaussian data. If nullptr is passed a vector will automatically be created of appropriate size, centered on zero.
The values of the data to be fitted to the Gaussian.
The lower-bound on the fit parameters. If nullptr is passed they will automatically be set by the Gdata dimensions with allowance.
The upper-bound on the fit parameters. If nullptr is passed they will automatically be set by the Gdata dimensions with allowance.
The returned errors on the fitted parameters. Pass nullptr if not required.
The returned residuals of the fit: Gdata[x] - fit[x]. Pass nullptr if not required.

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.Fit_Moffat1d(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[]@,System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Determines the non-linear least-squares fit parameters for a 1D Moffat curve M(x|p)
M(x|p) = p(0) * ( 1 + (x - p(1))^2 / p(2)^2 )^(-p(3)) + p(4)
member.param: The x data grid positions of the Moffat data. If nullptr is passed a vector will automatically be created of appropriate size, centered on zero.
The values of the data to be fitted to the Moffat.

The initial and return parameters of the Moffat. If p is only initialized and input with all zeros, initial estimates will automatically be computed.
p[0] = amplitude
p[1] = x-center
p[2] = theta
p[3] = beta
p[4] = bias
The errors on the fitted parameters. Pass nullptr if not required.
The residuals of the fit: Mdata[x] - M(x|p). Pass nullptr if not required.

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.Fit_Gaussian2d_Compound(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[0:,0:]@,System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[0:,0:]@,System.Double[0:,0:]@)
member.summary:
Determines the non-linear least-squares fit parameters for a field of n positively-oriented 2-d Gaussian surfaces G(x,y|p_n)
G(x,y|p_n) = Sum[p_n(0) * exp(-((x - p_n(1))^2 + (y - p_n(2))^2) / (2*p_n(3)^2))] + p(4)
or
G(x,y|p_n) = Sum[p_n(0) * exp(-((x - p_n(1))*cosd(p_n(3)) + (y - p_n(2))*sind(p_n(3)))^2 / (2*p_n(4)^2) - (-(x - p_n(1))*sind(p_n(3)) + (y - p_n(2))*cosd(p_n(3))).^2 / (2*p_n(5)^2) )] + p(6)
The form of G(x,y|p_n) used is determined by the horizontal length of the parameter vector p
member.param: The x-data grid positions of the Gaussian data.
The y-data grid positions of the Gaussian data.
The values of the data to be fitted to the Gaussian.

The initial and return parameters of the Gaussian. If p is only initialized and input with all zeros, initial estimates will automatically be computed. Options are:
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = sigma; p[4] = bias
or
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = phi; p[4] = x-sigma; p[5] = y-sigma; p[6] = bias.
The lower bound contraints on the fit parameters.
The upper bound contraints on the fit parameters.
The return errors on the fitted parameters. Pass an array of length 0 if not required.
The return residuals of the fit: Gdata[x, y] - fit[x, y]. Pass an array of length 0 if not required.

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.Fit_Moffat2d_Compound(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[0:,0:]@,System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double[0:,0:]@,System.Double[0:,0:]@)
member.summary:
Determines the non-linear least-squares fit parameters for a 2-d Moffat surface M(x,y|p)
M(x,y|p_n) = sum[p_n(0) * ( 1 + { (x - p_n(1))^2 + (y - p_n(2))^2 } / p_n(3)^2 )^(-p_n(4))] + p(5)
or
M(x,y|p_n) = sum[p_n(0) * ( 1 + { ((x - p_n(1))*cosd(p_n(3)) + (y - p_n(2))*sind(p_n(3)))^2 } / p_n(4)^2 + { (-(x - p_n(1))*sind(p_n(3)) + (y - p_n(2))*cosd(p_n(3)))^2 } / p_n(5)^2 )^(-p_n(6))] + p_n(7)
The form of M(x,y|p_n) used is determined by the length of the parameter vector p

p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = theta; p[4] = beta; p[5] = bias
or
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = phi; p[4] = x-theta; p[5] = y-theta; p[6] = beta; p[7] = bias
The lower bound contraints on the fit parameters.
The upper bound contraints on the fit parameters.
The return errors on the fitted parameters. Pass an array of length 0 if not required.

member.name: F:JPFITS.JPMath.PointSourceCompoundModel.CircularMoffat
member.summary:
M(x,y|p_n) = sum[p_n(0) * ( 1 + { (x - p_n(1))^2 + (y - p_n(2))^2 } / p_n(3)^2 )^(-p_n(4))] + p(5)
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = theta; p[4] = beta; p[5] = bias

member.name: F:JPFITS.JPMath.PointSourceCompoundModel.EllipticalMoffat
member.summary:
M(x,y|p_n) = sum[p_n(0) * ( 1 + { ((x - p_n(1))*cosd(p_n(3)) + (y - p_n(2))*sind(p_n(3)))^2 } / p_n(4)^2 + { (-(x - p_n(1))*sind(p_n(3)) + (y - p_n(2))*cosd(p_n(3)))^2 } / p_n(5)^2 )^(-p_n(6))] + p_n(7)
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = phi; p[4] = x-theta; p[5] = y-theta; p[6] = beta; p[7] = bias

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.alglib_Gauss_2d(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double@,System.Object)
member.summary:
Calculates a single point of a 2-d Gaussian surface G(x,y|p)
G(x,y|p) = p(0)*exp(-((x-p(1))^2 + (y - p(2))^2)/(2*p(3)^2)) + p(4)
or
G(x,y|p) = p(0)*exp(-((x-p(1))*cos(p(3)) + (y-p(2))*sin(p(3)))^2 / (2*p(4)^2) - (-(x-p(1))*sin(p(3)) + (y-p(2))*cos(p(3))).^2 / (2*p(5)^2) ) + p(6)
where x[0] is a position on X-axis x, and x[1] is a position on Y-axis y.
The form of G(x,y|p) used is determined by the length of the parmater vector p
member.param:
The initial parameters of the Gaussian fit. Options are:
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = sigma; p[4] = bias
or
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = theta; p[4] = x-sigma; p[5] = y-sigma; p[6] = bias
The x,y position to calculate the value val of the Gaussian G(x,y|p): x[0] = x, x[1] = y
The calculated value of the Gaussian.
obj.

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.alglib_Moffat_2d(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double@,System.Object)
member.summary:
Calculates a single point of a 2-d Moffat surface M(x,y|p)
M(x,y|p) = p(0) * ( 1 + { (x-p(1))^2 + (y-p(2))^2 } / p(3)^2 ) ^ (-p(4)) + p(5)
or
M(x,y|p) = p(0) * ( 1 + { ((x-p(1))*cos(p(3)) + (y-p(2))*sin(p(3)))^2 } / p(4)^2 + { (-(x-p(1))*sin(p(3)) + (y-p(2))*cos(p(3)))^2 } / p(5)^2 ) ^ (-p(6)) + p(7)
where x[0] is a position on X-axis x, and x[1] is a position on Y-axis y.
The form of M(x,y|p) used is determined by the length of the parmater vector "p"
member.param:
The initial parameters of the Moffat fit. Options are:
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = theta; p[4] = beta; p[5] = bias
or
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = phi; p[4] = x-theta; p[5] = y-theta; p[6] = beta; p[7] = bias
The x,y position to calculate the value val of the Moffat M(x,y|p): x[0] = x, x[1] = y
The calculated value of the Moffat.
obj.

Identifies and removes hot pixels from an image. The algorithm is not a simple find and replace, but assesses whether a pixel is part of a source
with legitimate high values or is a solitary or paired high value which is simply hot.

Perform array scan with parallelism.

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.Gaussian1d(System.Double[],System.Double[]@,System.Double[])
member.summary:
Computes the elements for a Gaussian curve G(x|p)
G(x|p) = p(0) * exp( -((x - p(1))^2) / (2*p(2)^2) ) + p(3)
member.param: The x-data grid positions of the Gaussian data. If nullptr is passed a vector will be created of appropriate size, centered on zero.
The values of the data to be computed for the Gaussian.

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.Moffat1d(System.Double[],System.Double[]@,System.Double[])
member.summary:
Computes the elements for a Moffat curve M(x|p)
M(x|p) = p(0) * ( 1 + (x - p(1))^2 / p(2)^2 )^(-p(3)) + p(4)
member.param: The x-data grid positions of the Moffat data. If nullptr is passed a vector will be created of appropriate size, centered on zero.
The values of the data to be computed for the Moffat.

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.Gaussian2d(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Computes the elements for a 2-d Gaussian surface G(x,y|p)
G(x,y|p) = p(0)*exp( -((x - p(1))^2 + (y - p(2))^2) / (2*p(3)^2) ) + p(4)
or
G(x,y|p) = p(0)*exp( -((x - p(1))*cosd(p(3)) + (y - p(2))*sind(p(3)))^2 / (2*p(4)^2) - (-(x - p(1))*sind(p(3)) + (y - p(2))*cosd(p(3))).^2 / (2*p(5)^2) ) + p(6)
The form of G(x,y|p) used is determined by the length of the parameter vector p
member.param: The x-data grid positions of the Gaussian data.
The y-data grid positions of the Gaussian data.

The parameters of the Gaussian. Options are:
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = sigma; p[4] = bias
or
p[0] = amplitude; p[1] = x-center; p[2] = y-center; p[3] = phi; p[4] = x-sigma; p[5] = y-sigma; p[6] = bias

member.name: M:JPFITS.JPMath.Moffat2d(System.Int32[],System.Int32[],System.Double[],System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Computes the elements for a 2-d Moffat surface M(x,y|p)
M(x,y|p) = p(0) * ( 1 + { (x-p(1))^2 + (y-p(2))^2 } / p(3)^2 ) ^ (-p(4)) + p(5)
or
M(x,y|p) = p(0) * ( 1 + { ((x-p(1))*cosd(p(3)) + (y-p(2))*sind(p(3)))^2 } / p(4)^2 + { (-(x-p(1))*sind(p(3)) + (y-p(2))*cosd(p(3)))^2 } / p(5)^2 ) ^ (-p(6)) + p(7)
The form of M(x,y|p) used is determined by the length of the parameter vector p
member.param: The x-data grid positions of the Moffat data.
The y-data grid positions of the Moffat data.

member.name: M:JPFITS.WCSAutoSolver.SolveWCS_EZ(JPFITS.FITSImage,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean[0:,0:])
member.summary:
Solves a WCS solution for a FITSImage and writes the WCS keywords into its header (but does not save the file). Should work for most visible and near-visible images, and uses a bunch of default settings.
Failure to solve is given by a false return, in which case you need to use a contructor and specify additional settings.
Queries GaiaDR3 with JPFITS.AstraCarta for the catalogue using http web request.
member.param: The FITSImage to solve the WCS for.
The plate scale of the image, to within +-5% (need not be totally precise). Arcseconds per pixel.
The saturation level of the image. For example, for 16bit ADU's, saturation occurs ~65,535, but you should specify a 15% lower value than this, so ~55e3.
The region of interest of the FITS image to search for point sources, of identical size to the FITS image. Pass null or all true for entire image.
